intro: Pedicularis muscoides var. typica, commonly known as the musk orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that resemble those of orchids. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in late summer. The species is noted for its aromatic scent, which is reminiscent of musk, hence its common name.
